means: （英国国教公祷书中的）连祷文

sentence.Network_en: She remained in the doorway, listening to his litany of complaints against her client.
sentence.Network_cn: 她站在门口，听他喋喋不休地抱怨她的客户。

sentence.Network_en: Dr. Middleton bowed to the litany.
sentence.Network_cn: 弥得尔顿博士对这种连祷俯首贴耳.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词汇分类(1) - linglong的日志 - 网易博客 ... vespers 夕祷 litany 连祷 sermon 讲经.
古代羔羊赞是以连祷文（Litany）方式在弥撒结束时唱出。公元七世纪，希腊籍教宗塞尔吉斯（Sergius 687-706在位）将羔羊赞订入 …
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(L) ... lit 点着 litany 冗长故事 litchi 荔枝.

list.abs: The television news was a daily litany of bombings and killings ., 电视新闻每天连续不断地报道爆炸和杀戮事件.
The patient recited a litany of complaints ., 那个患者抱怨个没完.
A litany of praise for the new professor ., 对新教授反复称颂.
three forms of the litany of the saints are at present in liturgical use ., 三形式的一连串的圣人是目前在礼仪使用.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French letanie, via ecclesiastical Latin from Greek litaneia 'prayer', from litē 'supplication'

entry.tran: 陈词滥调；枯燥冗长的陈述
entry.def: If you describe what someone says as a litany of things, you mean that you have heard it many times before, and you think it is boring or insincere.

example.ex: She remained in the doorway, listening to his litany of complaints against her client.
example.tran: 她站在门口，听他喋喋不休地抱怨她的客户。

entry.tran: 连祷；应答祈祷；启应祈祷
entry.def: A litany is part of a church service in which the priest says a set group of words and the people reply, also using a set group of words.

means.word_mean: 1. any long and tedious address or recital;

sentences.sentence: "the patient recited a litany of complaints"

auth_sentence.content: "No affection" heads the litany of her privations.

auth_sentence.content: His gold was reward for battling through a litany of injuries.
